item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】FLAC - ZARD - The 4th Studio Album - «Shifting Feelings» [16bits/44.1kHz]
item.description:
ZARD was a Japanese pop group under B-Gram RECORDS. Around the release of their third album, HOLD ME, all the band members had left except Izumi Sakai (坂井泉水, born on February 6, 1967). ZARD then became the solo project of Izumi, writing all the music and lyrics herself. According to an episode of Music Station in 2005, ZARD has sold a combined total of 35,450,000 copies, making her the #8 best selling artist in Japan.

ZARD also performed several songs that have been chosen as Japanese anime themes such as Meitantei Conan, Dragon Ball GT, and Slam Dunk. Since their debut, ZARD released 42 singles and 17 albums in total. Izumi's vocals are considered by many critics a high point of ZARD's music, which revolve around ballads.

Sakai was diagnosed with cervical cancer in June 2006; the cancer went into remission, but despite this onset, on April of 2007, the cancer was on the move again. On the 26th of May, while being treated for this cancer, Sakai fell three meters from a hospital staircase while returning to her room from a routine walk around the hospital. She was found at 5:40am. She suffered severe trauma to the back of her head (brain contusion), and on 3:10pm she died due to the cerebral contusion. The slippery surface of the staircase due to rain the previous day was blamed for her fall. Some rumors about suicide were being considered, but in the end discarded.

On June 27th 2007, a memorial funeral was held at Aoyama Cemetery.

«Shifting Feelings» is the fourth album of ZARD released on July 10, 1993.

1. Yureru omoi
2. Season
3. Kimi ga inai (B-version)
4. In my arms tonight
5. Anata wo suki dakedo
6. Makenaide
7. Listen to me
8. You and me (and...)
9. I want you
10. Futari no natsu



Hidden Content:
You must either reply or click 'Like' to see the hidden information contained here.
​
item.author: WithLoveSNSD

item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】FLAC - ZARD - The 5th Studio Album - «Oh My Love» [16bits/44.1kHz]
item.description:
ZARD was a Japanese pop group under B-Gram RECORDS. Around the release of their third album, HOLD ME, all the band members had left except Izumi Sakai (坂井泉水, born on February 6, 1967). ZARD then became the solo project of Izumi, writing all the music and lyrics herself. According to an episode of Music Station in 2005, ZARD has sold a combined total of 35,450,000 copies, making her the #8 best selling artist in Japan.

ZARD also performed several songs that have been chosen as Japanese anime themes such as Meitantei Conan, Dragon Ball GT, and Slam Dunk. Since their debut, ZARD released 42 singles and 17 albums in total. Izumi's vocals are considered by many critics a high point of ZARD's music, which revolve around ballads.

Sakai was diagnosed with cervical cancer in June 2006; the cancer went into remission, but despite this onset, on April of 2007, the cancer was on the move again. On the 26th of May, while being treated for this cancer, Sakai fell three meters from a hospital staircase while returning to her room from a routine walk around the hospital. She was found at 5:40am. She suffered severe trauma to the back of her head (brain contusion), and on 3:10pm she died due to the cerebral contusion. The slippery surface of the staircase due to rain the previous day was blamed for her fall. Some rumors about suicide were being considered, but in the end discarded.

On June 27th 2007, a memorial funeral was held at Aoyama Cemetery.

«Oh My Love» is the fifth album of ZARD released on June 6, 1994.

1. Oh My Love
2. Top Secret
3. Kitto Wasurenai
4. Mō Sukoshi Ato Sukoshi
5. Ame ni Nurete
6. Kono Ai ni Oyogi Tsukarete mo
7. I Still Remember
8. If You Gimme Smile
9. Rainen no Natsu mo
10. Anata ni Kaeritai
